result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher John Trzcianko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $300.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

No drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. No drug paraphernalia. 

Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Must maintain a full time job, school or job search/seek work.

Must complete any treatment or programming required by agent. 

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation. Not subject to good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher John Trzcianko

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant Christopher John Trzcianko in court. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Christopher John Trzcianko. Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Counsel stipulates to 6 days credit. On count 1- def- G plea. CT accepts plea, adj G. Def requests to waives PSI. Arguments. Def makes statement. 

SENTENCE: W/held sent 3 years probation. Must report to probation today. AODA and comply. 12 months banked/stayed jail. Not subj to GT. Must maintain full time job or full time job search. No drugs without a prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. Any treatment/programming required by agent. $300.05 fine/costs, $250 DNA surcharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. FPT- judgment. 6 days credit. 
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.
Count 2 RI&D on state's motion. PCR. 10:37 am adj.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. ARGN: Defense is preserved 15 days on prearraignment rights. Reading waived, plea NG. Bond cont. 10:08 am adj.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
